paragraphs.content: To the chief Musician, Maschil, for the sons of Korah.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To the chief Musician, Maschil, for the sons of Korah.

paragraphs.content: As the hart panteth after the water brooks, so panteth my soul after thee, O God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: As the hart panteth after the water brooks, so panteth my soul after thee, O God.

paragraphs.content: My soul thirsteth for God, for the living God: when shall I come and appear before God?
paragraphs.contentHtml: My soul thirsteth for God, for the living God: when shall I come and appear before God?

paragraphs.content: My tears have been my meat day and night, while they continually say unto me, Where is thy God?
paragraphs.contentHtml: My tears have been my meat day and night, while they continually say unto me, Where is thy God?

paragraphs.content: When I remember these things, I pour out my soul in me: for I had gone with the multitude, I went with them to the house of God, with the voice of joy and praise, with a multitude that kept holyday.
paragraphs.contentHtml: When I remember these things, I pour out my soul in me: for I had gone with the multitude, I went with them to the house of God, with the voice of joy and praise, with a multitude that kept holyday.

paragraphs.content: Why art thou cast down, O my soul? and why art thou disquieted in me? hope thou in God: for I shall yet praise him for the help of his countenance.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Why art thou cast down, O my soul? and why art thou disquieted in me? hope thou in God: for I shall yet praise him for the help of his countenance.

paragraphs.content: O my God, my soul is cast down within me: therefore will I remember thee from the land of Jordan, and of the Hermonites, from the hill Mizar.
paragraphs.contentHtml: O my God, my soul is cast down within me: therefore will I remember thee from the land of Jordan, and of the Hermonites, from the hill Mizar.

paragraphs.content: Deep calleth unto deep at the noise of thy waterspouts: all thy waves and thy billows are gone over me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Deep calleth unto deep at the noise of thy waterspouts: all thy waves and thy billows are gone over me.

paragraphs.content: Yet the LORD will command his lovingkindness in the daytime, and in the night his song shall be with me, and my prayer unto the God of my life.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Yet the Lord will command his lovingkindness in the daytime, and in the night his song shall be with me, and my prayer unto the God of my life.

paragraphs.content: I will say unto God my rock, Why hast thou forgotten me? why go I mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?
paragraphs.contentHtml: I will say unto God my rock, Why hast thou forgotten me? why go I mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?

paragraphs.content: As with a sword in my bones, mine enemies reproach me; while they say daily unto me, Where is thy God?
paragraphs.contentHtml: As with a sword in my bones, mine enemies reproach me; while they say daily unto me, Where is thy God?

paragraphs.content: Why art thou cast down, O my soul? and why art thou disquieted within me? hope thou in God: for I shall yet praise him, who is the health of my countenance, and my God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Why art thou cast down, O my soul? and why art thou disquieted within me? hope thou in God: for I shall yet praise him, who is the health of my countenance, and my God.
